page.title: 10Dock Park Dumfries
page.content: The Dock Park is on the south side of the River Nith. It is a place where old people come to relax and where young children can run around in reasonable saftey. When you enter the park there is a cannon to your left and in front is a park keepers hut in front of which is a paddling pool, a maze, some grass and three benches. The play area includes three swings, one helter skelter a roundabout and a climbing frame and a chute. A memorial to HMS Titanic which sank on her maiden voyage stands near the swings. The bandstand provides popular selections of music in the summer to family audiences and the bowling green, which is very secluded, provide pleasure, exercise and an opportunity to meet socialy to the late middle aged and old.
